skill.name: hybrid-cloud-networking
skill.description: Configure secure, high-performance connectivity between on-premises infrastructure and cloud platforms using VPN and dedicated connections. Use when building hybrid cloud architectures, connecting data centers to cloud, or implementing secure cross-premises networking.
skill.summary: Configure secure, high-performance connectivity between on-premises infrastructure and cloud platfor...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, data exfiltration, or execution patterns are present. Content is instructional with example configurations and commands. No malicious or obfuscated behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Hybrid connectivity can be complex and risky to design. This skill provides clear guidance for secure VPN and dedicated links with proven routing patterns.
actual_capabilities: Explain AWS, Azure, and GCP hybrid connectivity options
Provide Terraform examples for VPN gateways and connections
Describe hub-and-spoke, multi-region, and multi-cloud patterns
Outline BGP routing and route propagation guidance
List monitoring metrics and troubleshooting commands
limitations: Does not provision infrastructure or run cloud commands
Does not validate real network performance or SLAs
Requires existing cloud accounts and network details
Does not replace provider-specific security reviews

use_cases.title: Plan hybrid connectivity
use_cases.description: Choose VPN or dedicated links and define routing patterns for a new hybrid architecture.

use_cases.title: Harden hybrid links
use_cases.description: Apply security best practices and redundancy guidance for on-premises to cloud links.

use_cases.title: Phase cloud migration
use_cases.description: Design gradual migration connectivity with clear bandwidth and cost considerations.

prompt_templates.title: Choose connectivity
prompt_templates.scenario: New hybrid link for a small data center
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend VPN or dedicated connectivity for a small on-prem data center to AWS and explain the tradeoffs.

prompt_templates.title: Design hub and spoke
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a hub and spoke hybrid network using Transit Gateway or vWAN and list key routing steps.

prompt_templates.title: Plan multi cloud links
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a multi cloud hybrid design with Direct Connect, ExpressRoute, and Interconnect, including redundancy.

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshoot VPN issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a troubleshooting checklist for VPN tunnel instability and BGP session drops.

output_examples.input: Design a resilient AWS hybrid connection for two regions
output: Use dual Direct Connect links per region with BGP for failover
Add VPN as backup for each region
Enable route propagation and filter on-prem prefixes
Monitor tunnel status, latency, and BGP session health

best_practices: Use redundant tunnels or circuits with BGP failover
Prefer private connectivity for sensitive workloads
Monitor routing changes and tunnel health metrics
anti_patterns: Using a single VPN tunnel for production traffic
Advertising overly broad routes without filtering
Relying on public internet paths for critical data

faq.question: Is this compatible with AWS, Azure, and GCP?
faq.answer: Yes. It covers VPN and dedicated connectivity for AWS, Azure, and GCP.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples but does not validate live configurations.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes Terraform examples you can adapt to your modules.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or data?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not read local files or tokens.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot VPN instability?
faq.answer: Check tunnel status, BGP sessions, latency, and route propagation settings.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic networking advice?
faq.answer: It is focused on hybrid cloud providers and specific connectivity options.
